posts.cooked:
(We are using swerve drive) I’m trying to make our teams autonomous work using trajectories and the robot coordinate system is working fine (we are using limelight + apriltags for that) but the only issue is that the trajectory created doesn’t tell the robot to move in a straight line to its final position, instead following a path as pictured by the solid line.

Dashed line is what I want to achieve. image 735×649 666 Bytes

image 735×649 666 Bytes

image 735×649 666 Bytes

Thanks

posts.name: Max
posts.cooked: what are you using to make these trajectories? If your using Choreo, then you can just add a straight line constraint to the waypoints and that should fix your issue.

posts.name: unibots7237
posts.cooked: Were just using the WPILib trajectory generator

posts.name: Asher Olgeirson
posts.cooked: Likely, your headings are off. Try playing with them and see what changes.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: It looks like a nice trajectory for a robot pointing North and needs to turn around and translate South-West. I wonder what you intended. And PathWeaver doesn’t know of the capabilities of swerve drives, if that was your intention. Use PathPlanner for holonomic.

i think this is the problem, i had not set the IDs right so the back of the robot was the front and vice versa, and also didn’t flip the rotation of the limelight on the settings. Wasn’t able to do alot of testing but from a few trials it seemed to fix it, will confirm tomorrow
can confirm this was the problem. thankyou very much

posts.name: system
